post.body: Gotta say, I'm actually pleasantly surprised at how nice this is!

I've just set up a server which should be running Zeronet full time. If you need help seeding a website you're working on, comment here or send me a zeromail (johnhamelink@zeroid.bit) and I'll seed you.

Obviously nothing morally repugnant please :)

Rewriting our API's documentation using Swagger 2 (http://swagger.io) . We were using Swagger 1 before in our Ruby API by automatically building the docs from our API, but now that we have  >1 API and in different languages (Ruby and Elixir now), it makes more sense to have a manual Swagger definition which is defined in manually.

Which means I have to go through our auto-generated, then upgraded Swagger docs and make them correct.

This is going to take some time.

Joys.
I've had such a stressful day today. Sometimes I find it hard to keep my head above the water. But I have amazing friends that make life all worthwhile, and that's a really comforting feeling!

So yesterday was super stressful - today has been pretty awesome!

A friend messaged me to let me know they'd seen us on the front page of the iOS App store!

https://ipfs.pics/Qme2JYfK61S8fwjHa99sKwCrYoYrGUHLco3fkWd7cCLzM9

I need to get this book - sounds amazingly interesting:

https://www.theguardian.com/science/2016/aug/23/ancient-egypt-written-works-published-book-english-first-time

So the UK voted by 2% to leave the EU in June.

It's now mid-August, and the government have already confirmed that they plan to repeal the Human Rights Act.

What's even more shocking is that **only** 78% of the UK believe the Human Rights Act should apply to us all equally.

Madness.

https://www.humanism.scot/what-we-do/humanitie/the_human_rights_act/

Mr Robot fans in the house?

I came for the tech/computer theme, I stayed for the breathtaking intellectualism.

Very interesting conversation about just that on Reddit right now: https://www.reddit.com/r/MrRobot/comments/50uacu/no_spoilersmr_robot_is_a_piece_of_art/

Switched my window manager from Awesome to bspwm recently. Over the last 2 days I've swapped out a bunch of different other parts:

 - I'm using lemonbuddy with a better fork of lemonbar for my upper bar now - I found both on the Arch User Repository.
 - I switched to stalonetray from trayer and found a fork that would work with my dual screen setup on the Arch User Repository.
 - I installed the infinality bundle which made a huge difference to font rendering.
 - I found a _really_ nice weechat config in someone else's dotfiles and merged it with my config
 - I discovered a really nice dmenu replacement called rofi. I'm planning on using it for some custom code which will hopefully emulate Dash on OSX.

I'm loving the change and I really like bspwm now too! It feels much more responsive and lighter than Awesome.

 - [Desktop](https://u.teknik.io/q7E98.png)
 - [Weechat](https://u.teknik.io/JGxxu.png)
 - [Rofi](https://u.teknik.io/lQaz5.png)

If you're into this kinda stuff I'd recommend lurking around on Reddit's [/r/unixporn](https://reddit.com/r/unixporn) subreddit. I've found some really great ideas there!

comment.body: @Bot: yeah, it's pretty amazing. I've just set up a server to host what will be my website (once I've fixed some issues with it running on Zeronet). Really hope this takes off.
Thanks folks :) Sleep also does wonders!
@Alek: great! Let me know how it goes
@ks: Thanks I was just looking for it!
I don't believe you! Hahaha. I've never got hibernation/suspension working on any linux machine so I just pretend it's impossible :D

A quote I like in particular from that thread:

> Its the quintessential television show that reflects the ideas, themes, and concerns of the 21st century.
> - MNCs and banks "to-big-to-fail."
> - The Internet, digital rights and computer fraud and abuse.
> - Globalism, specifically a rising Chinese state whose regional power is starting to expand beyond its own borders.
> - Concerns over conspiracy and corruption within our own government and abroad.
> - A diverse cast of characters occupying with varied races and sexual orientations.
> - All wrapped up in a fascinating and multilayer story that keeps you guessing."
@Shellbound: Awesome info. I will definitely check them out! I was using dmenu2 before I gave Rofi a try. I'm really enjoying it!
@ks: Makes a big difference doesn't it!?
